entry.title: the glue that holds us together
entry.summary:
Author: the_sand_woman

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,787Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 4

Summary: Once, Alyssa Astor was destined to change the world. Instead, she walked straight into Gotham — the one place no one with a future ever goes willingly. But maybe destiny had other plans. Maybe in the city of broken things, she’d find something whole again — a family worth fighting for. or batfamily gets therapy in the form of alyssa-- Batfam & OC (Eventual) Bruce Wayne/OC

entry.title: Why Can't Anything Be Simple?
entry.summary:
Author: Megamagic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,221Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 306

Summary: Green Lantern and Batman are sent to another planet to try to stop a war that would consume a vast part of the galaxy.However in the middle of the mission the planet is attacked by a power hungry species who thrive on war. To protect the lives of everyone on the planet Batman surrenders himself to the leader of the species. Who is fascinated by making the man his pet. The Justice League rush to rescue their teammate but are met with many road blocks along the way. (Be aware this is a WIP and the tags are not updated fully. This is going to be a dark one so please re-check tags with every new chapter I post.)

entry.summary:

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,024Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 1,311

entry.title: I Wear The Black
entry.summary:
Author: Gezmall

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,220Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 35

Summary: There is an impostor running around Gotham. A billowing figure tanking gunshots like they were confetti. He wore the bat-symbol like it was his own, but with spikes across his shoulders and back, making it clear he was not the friendly type. The cape, large and reflecting no light, split by the end in tendrils, which attached themselves to the ceiling and the sprawled bodies and the columns like itty-bitty grappling hooks. No. Not like grappling hooks per se, Nightwing numbly noted. Like small batclaws. "That was not Batman," Nightwing reminisced with more ease than he felt. "There's a fairily," he raised his hand where the real Batman's height ended, "big difference."

entry.title: Gotham Harbor
entry.summary:
Author: thebatdadnomad (aylooktaekook)

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,629Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 90

Summary: “Bruce, you’re self-destructing,” Tim cut in, and the room went silent for a tense moment as he absorbed the assertion. The pair of them eyed him down with their respective devices – a laptop and a duster – in hand, as he considered leaving now or admitting it all like his lips so direly wanted to do. But Bruce’s mind told him no. Or, Bruce hurts his family so he can drown himself in Gotham Harbor.

entry.title: Bruce Goes Batty
entry.summary:
Author: AtlasDaMoth

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,797Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 782

Summary: In Bruce Wayne's opinion, as The Batman and Gotham's Billionaire, magic was both incredibly illogical, and quite stupid. Guns, swords, secret plots and evil schemes, he could deal with it all. Except for magic. Spells, curses, it was all unknown to him, and he hated it.He formed that idea on the subject at least a good three years ago. And now, as he stares at himself in the mirror, shaking hands gripping the long bat ears that had sprouted upon his head, he finds himself proven right yet again.Magic. Stupid, stupid magic.

entry.title: Hal vs the Batfam
entry.summary:
Author: Phoenix_feathers17

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,445Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 1,936

Summary: It all started when Hal first met them (If you can call what happened a meeting). It couldn't say exactly how his first encounter went down as he had been too confused to keep up with all that happened around him. It was after his second encounter with one, though, that everything started to go downhill. For some reason, he had caught the sight of the batkids (yes, batkids. The Batman had kids) and now he just had to survive their antics until Bats decided to introduce them to the rest of the league. Oa help him if that doesn't happen soon.

entry.title: Another Perspective
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,468Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 142

Summary: A clash of opposing plans causes Batman to accidentally be doused with a hybrid of not-quite-Fear Toxin and Ivy's pheromones. In order to cope with the opposing influences, his brain convinces him that the four Rogues who were keyed to them - Scarecrow, Ivy, Harley Quinn, and Riddler - have been deaged into children. Obviously he'll have to bring them home and look after them until an antidote is made. Meanwhile, by order of the Batkids in order to NOT break Batman's mind, said Rogues are forced to play along.

entry.title: The Hundred Day Curse
entry.summary:
Author: SolaceInSpace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 133,842Chapters: 35/?Kudos: 3,973

Summary: Gotham was literally cursed but no one believed Bruce. He took it upon himself to fix it and after decades of searching, that solution came to him in the form of a little blue vial. Bruce was to take the curse within himself to temper it into something manageable.He thinks the others would call him stupid and stop him if they knew about this, but (un)fortunately for Bruce, his family hasn't spoken to him for forever. There was no one here to stop him.He downed the liquid and woke up as his nine-year-old self.Ch3 Excerpt:“Mother, do you remember those funny clouds above people’s heads I told you about? Well, I’m doing something about them but the process is very lonely. Or not. I think it’s just me. I’m the problem. I can’t seem to get people to like me enough to stay. I know–-… I’m aware that it’s due to my own shortcomings but sometimes, it feels like even the worst monsters have people that love them and yet I have no one.”Bruce let out a humourless chuckle and rested his forehead on his knees.“I just wish there was someone that cared about me.”

entry.title: In Alternate Relation
entry.summary:
Author: Effi_Bee

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,239Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 387

Summary: As he lay on his back in the snow, his soon to be murderer already long gone, he couldn’t help but find this situation ironically funny. How it started this way; a bullet lodging itself into a chest. The start and-however pathetic-end of Spider-Man. He had gone full circle now. Hilarious. or Peter Benjamin Parker dies in his world alone and forgotten, only to appear in a different dimension on a different earth in an unknown city with mysterious heroes. Vigilantes? Or are they just urban legends? He decides to start a new chapter in his-new-life, because isn't that what you do when you are supposed to be dead? You move on. (It doesn't matter that it's not really working. It's the effort that counts.) or Another Peter Parker in Gotham fic, but with a twist (and make it Nightswinger).

entry.title: mantle
entry.summary:
Author: whenicarusflies

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 516Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: Bruce always knew that his body would give up on him eventually.All the magic, all the fitness regimes, all the willpower in the world would not stop a human from aging.------No. 13: “How dull is it to pause, to make an end, to rust unburnished.” | Never Enough | Insignia | Forced Retirement

entry.title: Gotham’s personal devil.
entry.summary:
Author: Agentph03n1x

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,696Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 334

Summary: The day started off like any usual day in the hotel, ghosts huddled around the TV chatting obnoxiously loud, Ester practicing her dark magic, Ben trying to boost his ego and failing in doing so, Nathan trying to work the front desk but scaring off potential customers when his hand goes through keys instead of grabbing them. The same old normal they have become so used to after living in the hotel for so long. However, Abaddon had bigger plans in mind today, yes today on this faithful day, Abaddon was finally going to capture the Moth-man, his arch nemesis since the dawn of time.
